page.title: 18TRADE
page.content: In this area there are varied businesses, large and small, from agricultural suppliers to antique dealers. There is no shop in Broadwell now, apart from the Post Office, but the shop in Oddington has existed since 1728. It is used by locals to buy groceries. It is also an off- licence and post office. There are a variety of shops within a five mile radius but few large supermarkets. A popular market is held every Tuesday in Moreton-in Marsh where fresh goods, clothing etc. are sold. There are free buses to and from nearby villages. Roadside stalls sell eggs and vegetables, and an Oddington farmer offers 'pick-your-own' fruit and vegetables. Broadwell residents are able to collect newspapers from the Fox Inn and travelling tradesmen (baker etc.) visit the village.
